data.title: AWS launches discounted spot capacity for its Fargate container platform
data.text: AWS today quietly brought spot capacity to Fargate, its serverless compute engine for containers that supports both the company’s Elastic Container Service and, now, its Elastic Kubernetes service. Like spot instances for the EC2 compute platform, Fargate Spot pricing is significantly cheaper, both for storage and compute, than regular Fargate pricing.

data.title: AWS launches new local zone in LA
data.text: AWS announced a new local zone today in LA, designed to provide customers in southern California with a set of higher bandwidth, lower latency compute resources. It’s not a coincidence that this area is the epicenter of the entertainment industry.

data.title: Amazon's cloud business bombards the market with dozens of new features to preserve its lead
data.text: Amazon Web Services now has over 175 products on offer for its millions of customers.

data.title: Verizon and AWS announce 5G Edge computing partnership
data.text: Just as Qualcomm was starting to highlight its 5G plans for the coming years, Verizon CEO Hans Vestberg hit the stage at AWS re:Invent to discuss the carrier’s team up with the cloud computing giant. As part of Verizon’s (TechCrunch’s parent company, disclosure, disclosure, disclosure) upcoming focus on 5G edge computing, the carrier will be […]

data.title: Verizon CEO Hans Vestberg on AWS partnership
data.text: AWS just announced it is partnering with Verizon on making AWS Wavelength available across the United States.

data.title: AWS announces new enterprise search tool powered by machine learning
data.text: Today at AWS re:Invent in Las Vegas, the company announced a new search tool called Kendra, which provides natural language search across a variety of content repositories using machine learning. Matt Wood, AWS VP of artificial intelligence said that the new search tool uses machine learning, but doesn’t actually require machine learning expertise of any […]

data.title: Amazon partners with Verizon on 5G in cloud computing expansion
data.text: Amazon.com Inc on Tuesday said it was extending its cloud to 5G networks in partnership with Verizon Communications Inc, so developers can run latency-sensitive programs on mobile and connected devices.

data.title: Amazon designs more powerful data center chip
data.text: Amazon.com Inc (AMZN.O) said on Tuesday it had designed a more powerful data center processor chip, as it looks to pose a serious challenge to the domination of market leaders Intel Corp (INTC.O) and Advanced Micro Devices Inc (AMD.O).

data.title: Amazon Web Services CEO Andy Jassy: There's no incentive to spin off AWS
data.text: CNBC's Jon Fortt breaks down his interview with Amazon Web Services CEO Andy Jassy on the likelihood the company could be spun off from Amazon.

data.title: AWS announces AutoPilot, more visible AutoML in SageMake Studio
data.text: Today at AWS re:Invent in Las Vegas, the company announced AutoPilot, a new tool that gives you greater visibility into automated machine learning model creation, known as AutoML. This new tool is part of the new SageMaker Studio also announced today.

data.title: Watch CNBC's full interview with Amazon Web Services chief Andy Jassy
data.text: CNBC's Jon Fortt sits down with Amazon Web Services CEO Andy Jassy on adding three new products to the Amazon's cloud division, including Outposts, Local Zones and WaveLength, which helps improve mobile speeds by cutting out a few steps

data.title: Amazon just partnered with Verizon to improve 5G speeds
data.text: Amazon Web Services is using 5G networks to help its customers download data from the cloud faster.

data.title: AWS’ CodeGuru uses machine learning to automate code reviews
data.text: AWS today announced CodeGuru, a new machine learning-based service that automates code reviews based on the data the company has gathered from doing code reviews internally. Developers write the code and simply add CodeGuru to the pull requests.

data.title: Amazon cloud boss targets Microsoft’s core business, eyes $3.7 trillion enterprise IT market
data.text: LAS VEGAS — Amazon Web Services CEO Andy Jassy put the company’s neighboring tech giant directly in his sights here Tuesday morning, criticizing Microsoft’s licensing practices and making it clear that Amazon is going directly after the Redmond company’s core business.

data.title: AWS' Andy Jassy: JEDI cloud contract was not adjudicated correctly
data.text: Amazon Web Services CEO Andy Jassy discusses the company's petition against the Department of Defense's decision to award Microsoft with the Joint Enterprise Defense Infrastructure contract.

data.title: AWS AutoPilot gives you more visible AutoML in SageMaker Studio
data.text: Today at AWS re:Invent in Las Vegas, the company announced AutoPilot, a tool that gives you greater visibility in automated machine learning model creation. This is available as part of the new SageMaker Studio also announced today.

data.title: AWS launches managed Cassandra services
data.text: Today at Amazon re:Invent, Amazon announced a new ability to manage Cassandra databases on AWS. Already used by companies as diverse as Grubhub.com, Netflix, Ooyala, Openwave, Reddit, and Uber, to manage distributed NoSQL databases, that handle large amounts of data across commodity servers,  the new Amazon Managed Apache Cassandra Service, is AWS’ attempt to offer […]

data.title: AWS launches Sagemaker Studio, a web-based IDE for machine learning
data.text: At its re:Invent conference, AWS CEO Andy Jassy today announced the launch of SageMaker Studio, a web-based IDO for building and training machine learning workflows. It includes everything a data scientist would need to get started with, including ways to organize notebooks, data sets, code and models, for example.

data.title: AWS announces UltraWarm tier for Amazon Elasticsearch Service
data.text: AWS announced a new tier for Amazon Elasticsearch Service. And it could potentially lead to some cost savings.

data.title: AWS speeds up Redshift queries 10x with AQUA
data.text: At its re:Invent conference, AWS CEO Andy Jassy today announced the launch of AQUA (the Advanced Query Accelerator) for Amazon Redshift, the company’s data warehousing service. As Jassy noted in his keynote, it’s hard to scale data warehouses when you want to do analytics over that data.

data.title: AWS announces EKS on Fargate is available
data.text: Today at AWS re:Invent in Las Vegas, the company announced that Elastic Kubernetes Service is available on Fargate. EKS is Amazon’s flavor of Kubernetes.

data.title: Amazon.com's Amazing Rise Wins It Top FreightTech 25 Honors
data.text: Looking at the retailing and logistics colossus that Amazon.com, Inc. (NASDAQ: AMZN) has become, it's hard to comprehend how the company went about its delivery business 20 years ago.

data.title: Microsoft fairly and squarely beat Amazon in $10 billion Pentagon cloud contract
data.text: The prestigious contract went to the superior company, despite detractors who claim President Trump opposed Amazon.

data.title: Target & Walmart Vs Amazon: Who Will Win The Holiday Season?
data.text: Amazon is best positioned to be the winner of this year’s holiday shopping season.

data.title: AWS announces new ARM-based instances with Graviton2 processors
data.text: AWS, the cloud division of Amazon, just announced the next generation of its ARM processors, the Graviton2. This is a custom chip design with a 7nm architecture.

data.title: 9 Tech Stocks You Wish You’d Bought During 2019
data.text: Gambling on the outcome of the U.S.-China trade war is starting to become a fool’s errand again.

data.title: AWS launches its custom Inferentia inferencing chips
data.text: At its re:Invent conference, AWS today announced the launch of its Inferentia chips, which it initially announced last year. These new chips promise to make inferencing, that is, using the machine learning models you pre-trained earlier, significantly faster and cost effective.

data.title: How Amazon created AWS and changed technology forever
data.text: SEATTLE — Twenty years ago, Amazon.com Inc. was an online bookstore that was powered by the same servers and systems that other companies used.

data.title: Amazon doubles truck fleet to 20,000 to boost shipping capacity amid booming holiday sales
data.text: A record number of Amazon-branded trucks are driving up and down freeways across the U.S. this holiday season, the latest sign of the major expansion of the tech giant’s delivery operation.

data.title: Amazon gives green light to new solar projects in the US and Spain
data.text: The sites will be located in Spain, Illinois and Northern Virginia.

data.title: Amazon Enters Quantum Computing Market With Amazon Braket
data.text: Amazon's (AMZN) AWS announces preview launch of its quantum computing service, Amazon Braket, which will strengthen its market position.

data.title: Trump's Zigs And Zags On Trade Make Sense In This Context As Dow Jones Sinks
data.text:

data.text: This Cyber Monday set all kinds of sales records, including one that has become something of an annual tradition: Monday was Amazon's biggest shopping day in the company's history.

data.title: Barron's: Amazon 'One-Day Delivery' Is More Trouble Than It's Worth
data.text: Amazon.com Inc’s (AMZN: NASDAQ) plan to increase the number of one-day shipping on its platform could prove detrimental to the company, Barron’s said on Sunday.
